title: Use published version for secp crate
body:
- Switch to the published version of parity-secp256k1 (that was required in order to publish parity-crypto)
- As I used the latest version of parity-secp256k1 I was able to switch this crate to rand-0.7.2

title: [impl-serde]: add benches `Bytes` and `hex_to_uint`
body: This PR adds benchmarks for `to/from Bytes` and `hex to uint` as a bonus I added `rust 2018` because it was so trivial.

title: export FromDecStrErr
body: My project needs to be able to convert from uint's error type to my project's error type. This should make it possible to do this without needing to add uint as a direct dependency of my project.

title: Fix old syntax in the README of crate uint
body: The syntax actually reported is not working and is different from that present in the test and the examples folders.

title: Upgrade dependencies
body:
The hard work was done by `cargo upgrade`.  Split out by request of
@niklasad1.

title: Replace `uninitialized` with `MaybeUninit`
body:
`mem::uninitialized` is deprecated and unsafe.  This replaces its use
with `mem::MaybeUninit` and adds a proof that the use of
`mem::MaybeUninit` is correct.

Requested by @niklasad1.

Fixes #238.

title: Update to 2018 edition idioms
body: As requested by @niklasad1.

title: [trace-time] migrate code to 2018 edition
body: Part of #143

title: [parity-util-mem] migrate code to 2018 edition
body:
Migrate parity-util-mem to 2018 edition
Part of #143

title: Use default Xenial dist
body:
Xenial is now the default:

* https://blog.travis-ci.com/2019-04-15-xenial-default-build-environment

title: Rename complete_unbounded_list to finalize_unbounded_list
body: Fixes https://github.com/paritytech/parity-common/issues/204.

title: Bump parking_lot version
body:
Implies 0.2 of `kvdb-memorydb` and `kvdb-web`.

[parity-ethereum PR](https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/pull/11091)

title: [kvdb-web] bump futures-preview to 0.3.0-alpha.18
body: Seems like substrate upgraded to .18 in https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/3656.

title: [fixed-hash] Migrated code to the 2018 edition and updated dependencies
[kvdb-memorydb] Migrated code to 2018 edition, updated parking_lot
[kvdb-rocksdb] Migrated code to 2018 edition, updated dependencies
Find PendingIterator in Transaction Pool
body: When encountering a `Stale` transaction in the `PendingIterator`, we should try to use the next best transaction for this sender.

title: update rand to 0.7 (breaking change)
body:
Updates a bunch of crates to use `rand 0.7`.

It is needed by paritytech/parity-ethereum#11022 but I don't know if it makes sense anymore see RustSec/advisory-db#149 for details.

We could put it on ice if it is too messy

title: [parity-bytes] alloc crate has stabilized
body: Signed-off-by: koushiro <koushiro.cqx@gmail.com>

title: Move ethkey crypto utils to parity crypto crate
body:
The intention of this PR is to remove dependency to accounts\ethkey for parity components, that use crypto utils from it. That would allow further decomposition of parity repo. Including move of secret store  into the separate repo.
Additional comments:
1. I straightforwardly merged code from ethkey into parity crypto, that is responsible for work with key pairs, encryption etc.

- I left wallets code (brain, brain prefix etc) in ethkey. Also left password.rs there
- I didn't do any renaming and reorganization of parity crypto crate. May be it's worth doing, but I don't have good ideas and would be grateful for any suggestions.

2. I'm not going to consider substrate code, related to the same crypto primitives. It's left for the further development.

title: [impl-serde] add a uint bench
body:
This PR adds a u256 serde bench to #208.
Demi's brach seems faster by 3-15% on u256 :
```
u256_to_hex//0          time:   [38.087 ns 38.175 ns 38.271 ns]                            
                        change: [-2.3863% -1.5812% -0.9421%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Change within noise threshold.
Found 3 outliers among 100 measurements (3.00%)
  1 (1.00%) high mild
  2 (2.00%) high severe
u256_to_hex//100        time:   [40.901 ns 40.992 ns 41.087 ns]                              
                        change: [-12.317% -11.367% -10.697%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
Found 16 outliers among 100 measurements (16.00%)
  8 (8.00%) low mild
  6 (6.00%) high mild
  2 (2.00%) high severe
u256_to_hex//4294967295 time:   [45.961 ns 46.160 ns 46.459 ns]                                     
                        change: [-15.873% -15.432% -14.964%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
Found 4 outliers among 100 measurements (4.00%)
  2 (2.00%) high mild
  2 (2.00%) high severe
u256_to_hex//18446744073709551615                                                                            
                        time:   [52.170 ns 52.283 ns 52.404 ns]
                        change: [-10.915% -10.565% -10.202%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
Found 5 outliers among 100 measurements (5.00%)
  4 (4.00%) high mild
  1 (1.00%) high severe
u256_to_hex//340282366920938463463374607431768211455                                                                            
                        time:   [66.595 ns 66.722 ns 66.844 ns]
                        change: [-9.9015% -9.6131% -9.3351%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
u256_to_hex//25108406941546723056364004793593481054836439088298861789185                                                                            
                        time:   [86.697 ns 86.972 ns 87.321 ns]
                        change: [-3.4843% -2.8598% -2.1879%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
Found 7 outliers among 100 measurements (7.00%)
  2 (2.00%) high mild
  5 (5.00%) high severe

```

title: Speed up hex serialization and fix warnings
body:
This uses unsafe code (with a proof of safety) to speed up
serialization.  It also fixes a warning due to a deprecated `...` range
pattern.

The benches in `ethereum-types` are quite outdated and are subset of `uint` benches, so I removed them.

title: [kvdb-web] indexeddb implementation
body:
This is an alternative implementation for #182 based on IndexedDB (cc @tomaka).
Writes data both into memory and IndexedDB, reads from the IndexedDB on `open`.

Closes #182.

title: [triehash] update hash-db, bump version
body: This is a prerequisite for upgrading parity-util-mem in parity-ethereum.

title: Introduce `ContractAddress` newtype instead of scheme enum
body:
Not all variants of scheme used all the parameters of the previous `contract_address` function, yet they still needed to be passed.

I took a shot at redesigning the interface of this crate to allow for the most convenient usage.

Let me know what you think!

The two methods `from_sender_salt_and_code` and `from_sender_and_code` both return a tuple with the computed hash. I don't know how these methods are actually being used, so I don't know if we actually need that return value. It seems a bit odd to me because it looks like the hash is an implementation detail of how to compute the address and should be hidden inside the function.

title: [uint] fix outdated README.md
body: Fixes #198.

title: Fix compiler error with not being able to resolve types
Modified AsRef impl for U-type macros
body:
- Potential bug with current implementation that led to unused API
- Replaced with useful internal getter for &[u64] types

Fixes: #195

title: Impl encodelike
body:
I actually forget to implement EncodeLike for some types.

although this is not super needed as EncodeLike is implemented for a reference to them.

Also I don't plan to publish now except it someone say so.

I updated PrimitiveTypes so one that depends on primitive can update in its cargo toml without having to import impl-codec. (or he can just do cargo update -p impl-codec but then information is not in cargo.toml anymore)

title: Update codec + new version of primitive-types
body:
no need to bump version of ethereum-types, keccack-hash because major release is not published.

After merge I add tag and publish versions

Fixes #186.

title: [parity-crypto] replace memzero with zeroize
body: cc https://github.com/paritytech/parity-common/pull/183

title: [parity-util-mem] add support for mimalloc
body: Fixes #180

title: [parity-util-mem] remove Memzero
body:
Closes #181. **This is a breaking change.**
We could probably reexport zeroize's `Zeroizing` as `Memzero`, but I don't see any benefits of that. Also I'm in favor of Single Responsibility Principle and if a crate wants to (only) use `zeroize` functionality, it doesn't have to depend on allocator stuff.

title: triehash trie dependency update
body:
This PR update trie dependencies of triehash (new minor version). This is needed for deprecation of heapsize in parity ethereum.

PS: I got a huge commit history, but squash and merge shall be fine (diff is small)
